name: Joyner v. Philadelphia Transportation Company, Appellant

judges: Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
Mr. Justice Cohen would grant a new trial.
parties: Joyner v. Philadelphia Transportation Company, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Pee Curiam,
Judgment affirmed.
Mr. Justice Cohen would grant a new trial.
opinions.author: Pee Curiam,

attorneys: Ha/rry A. Tahiff, with him James Gonwell Welsh, for appellant.
Benjamin Kuby, with him Paul N. Minhoff, William D. Harris, and Klovshy, Kuby and Harris, for appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Joyner v. Philadelphia Transportation Company, Appellant.
Argued November 19, 1968.
Before Bell, C. J., Jones, Cohen, Eagen, O’Brien and Roberts, JJ.
April 23, 1969:
Ha/rry A. Tahiff, with him James Gonwell Welsh, for appellant.
Benjamin Kuby, with him Paul N. Minhoff, William D. Harris, and Klovshy, Kuby and Harris, for appellee.
